main event: An object appeared as a bright, high-altitude, fast-moving, luminous object, compared in brightness to a star. The object was sighted at an azimuth of 50°, elevation 40°, heading northeast, slightly south, at high speed, and an altitude of about 50-60 miles. The passage took about 2-3 minutes, and no distinct sounds were heard.
interesting points: The object appeared to stand still at times, suddenly speed up and rush away, and change brightness.
The witness estimated the object's angular size by holding a matchstick at arm's length, but did not provide the specific measurement.
The witness was located in the residential section of a city and observed the object through a residential area.
The witness had previously seen a similar object in the same location.
The witness reported the sighting to the Air Force on June 7, 1967.
sighted object: a bright, high-altitude, fast-moving, luminous object
photographs: no photographs, only a typed report
